meanings.definition: The simultaneous transmission of signals in a communication system, causing interference.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the crosstalks between the speakers made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: The technician fixed the crosstalks in the phone lines to improve the call quality.
meanings.sent3: The crosstalks at the party were so loud that it felt like everyone was talking at once.
meanings.sent4: The crosstalks of opinions in the debate created a chaotic atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The crosstalks of radio signals in the airwaves created a jumble of noise.

meanings.definition: A conversation or discussion between two or more people or groups.
meanings.sent1: The crosstalks between the students in the group project helped them brainstorm ideas.
meanings.sent2: The crosstalks at the family dinner table were filled with laughter and stories.
meanings.sent3: The crosstalks during the game night added to the fun and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The crosstalks of different languages at the international conference symbolized unity.
meanings.sent5: The crosstalks between the characters in the play revealed their true feelings.
